snippet: Two suspects in a soldier’s death made separate court appearances as politicians met to seek ways of thwarting what the government has called the “poisonous narrative” of militant Islamic radicalization.
abstract: Michael Adebolajo and Michael Adebowale, two Muslim men of Nigerian descent accused of hacking an off-duty British soldier to death in London, appear in separate courts for hearings; in same week, British politicians hold first meeting of panel focused on combating Islamic radicalization of young people in the country in order to prevent future attacks like this.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: Two suspects in a soldier’s death made separate court appearances as politicians met to seek ways of thwarting what the government has called the “poisonous narrative” of militant Islamic radicalization.

headline.seo: British Leaders Tackle Radicalization After Killing
